content:
Hey, I'm trying out Lean for some functional programming, and I saw that there is Std.Time for working with time and date.
But I couldn't find any functions to get the current system time/date. Does that exist anywhere?

Sure, you can use one of these:

import Std.Time

open Std.Time

#eval Timestamp.now
#eval ZonedDateTime.now
#eval PlainDateTime.now
#eval PlainDate.now
#eval PlainTime.now

@Markus Himmel oh thank you, I can't seem to find now in the docs.
Additionally my stable lean toolchain doesn't have Std.Time, I suppose it's only in nightly yet?

docs#Std.Time.PlainDate.now is declared in a different file.

Std.Time is not part of any stable Lean release yet. It will be in Lean 4.15.0, to be released in January. You can set your lean-toolchain to leanprover/lean4:v4.15.0-rc1 to use it right now (with the usual caveats of using pre-release software).
ohh I see, thank you! The search in the docs doesn't seem to be ideal so I didn't notice the now functions in between other results.
Luna Schwalbe has marked this topic as resolved.
